intro: Platylobium montanum subsp. montanum, commonly known as the mountain platylobium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in heathland and sandplain environments, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in coastal and inland regions of Western Australia. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
